document.masterDocTitle: Velvet ants (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) of the Algodones sand dunes of California, USA

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Velvet ants (Hymenoptera: Mutillidae) of the Algodones sand dunes of California, USA

DNA voucher specimen data.
California ,
Imperial Co ., Algodones Sand Dunes
,
2 males
, JP 87 , JP 129 ( EMUS ); 5 mi . SW Glamis,
1 female
,
23 .Jul. 2005
, K.A. Williams, JP 717 ( EMUS ).
Distribution. Southern California and western Arizona into Mexico .

Remarks. This species is not limited to the Algodones Sand Dunes and surrounding areas, but is particularly abundant on these dunes. Only ITS 1 was obtained from both a male and a female of this species. The intersexual distance for ITS 1 is low, 0.6 % (Table 1 ). The morphology of this female is similar to the female of its close relative
S. orestes (Fox)
and could be easily confused with
S. ecarinata
.
